snippet: Twitter says it cannot possibly regulate the millions of messages on its service, and that a bit of misinformation and mischief is to be expected.
abstract: Tens of thousands of people turn to Twitter during Hurricane Sandy for alerts, updates and real-time reports of storm; company says that it cannot possibly regulate the millions of messages on its service, which have included several pieces of misinformation and mischievous posts.
lead_paragraph: Twitter says it cannot possibly regulate the millions of messages on its service, and that a bit of misinformation and mischief is to be expected.

headline.seo: On Twitter, Sifting Through Falsehoods in Critical Times
headline.main: On Twitter, Sifting Through Falsehoods in Critical Times
headline.print_headline: In Twitter, a Tool for Salvation, and for Silliness
